definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: I want to tell everyone, including those frustrations.
sentences.chinese: 我要告訴所有人，包括那些失意者。

sentences.english: They, too, are a good barometer of who is up and who is down.
sentences.chinese: 這同樣也是體現誰家得勢誰家失意很好的晴雨表。

sentences.english: Annie, your husband is a disappointed man.

sentences.english: Do not you see right close the door closed Gillian long, life is frustrated no north and south.

sentences.english: The robots might become a new target for frustrated colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 機器人也許會成爲失意同事的新目標。

sentences.english: Many abusers use violence to express the frustrations and hopelessness that come from depression.

sentences.english: The priority for policymakers must be to keep the number of losers as small as possible.
sentences.chinese: 決策者的當務之急是儘量減少這些失意者的數量。

sentences.english: When you are disappointed, might as well try to open a living another small window.

sentences.english: More failure and diffcults due to the short and lack of a gratitude heart.

sentences.english: Leafs will be astrut in breeze but chill when gale makes them falling down.
sentences.chinese: 樹葉得勢時趾高氣揚，失意時威風掃地。

sentences.english: Forget about the day when it'sbeen cloudy, But don't forget your hour in the sun.

definition: to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
soured by the loss of one's hopes
flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to be indecisive
down and out/in dire straits/unrestrained/unconventional/also pr. [luo4 tuo4]
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
